verses.name: Job 20:1
verses.text: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,

verses.name: Job 20:2
verses.text: Therefore do my thoughts cause me to answer, and for this I make haste.

verses.name: Job 20:3
verses.text: I have heard the check of my reproach, and the spirit of my understanding causeth me to answer.

verses.name: Job 20:4
verses.text: Knowest thou not this of old, since man was placed upon earth,

verses.name: Job 20:5
verses.text: That the triumphing of the wicked is short, and the joy of the hypocrite but for a moment?

verses.name: Job 20:6
verses.text: Though his excellency mount up to the heavens, and his head reach unto the clouds;

verses.name: Job 20:7
verses.text: Yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung: they which have seen him shall say, Where is he?

verses.name: Job 20:8
verses.text: He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found: yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.

verses.name: Job 20:9
verses.text: The eye also which saw him shall see him no more; neither shall his place any more behold him.

verses.name: Job 20:10
verses.text: His children shall seek to please the poor, and his hands shall restore their goods.

verses.name: Job 20:11
verses.text: His bones are full of the sin of his youth, which shall lie down with him in the dust.

verses.name: Job 20:12
verses.text: Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth, though he hide it under his tongue;

verses.name: Job 20:13
verses.text: Though he spare it, and forsake it not; but keep it still within his mouth:

verses.name: Job 20:14
verses.text: Yet his meat in his bowels is turned, it is the gall of asps within him.

verses.name: Job 20:15
verses.text: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.

verses.name: Job 20:16
verses.text: He shall suck the poison of asps: the viper’s tongue shall slay him.

verses.name: Job 20:17
verses.text: He shall not see the rivers, the floods, the brooks of honey and butter.

verses.name: Job 20:18
verses.text: That which he laboured for shall he restore, and shall not swallow it down: according to his substance shall the restitution be, and he shall not rejoice therein.

verses.name: Job 20:19
verses.text: Because he hath oppressed and hath forsaken the poor; because he hath violently taken away an house which he builded not;

verses.name: Job 20:20
verses.text: Surely he shall not feel quietness in his belly, he shall not save of that which he desired.

verses.name: Job 20:21
verses.text: There shall none of his meat be left; therefore shall no man look for his goods.

verses.name: Job 20:22
verses.text: In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits: every hand of the wicked shall come upon him.

verses.name: Job 20:23
verses.text: When he is about to fill his belly, God shall cast the fury of his wrath upon him, and shall rain it upon him while he is eating.

verses.name: Job 20:24
verses.text: He shall flee from the iron weapon, and the bow of steel shall strike him through.

verses.name: Job 20:25
verses.text: It is drawn, and cometh out of the body; yea, the glittering sword cometh out of his gall: terrors are upon him.

verses.name: Job 20:26
verses.text: All darkness shall be hid in his secret places: a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.

verses.name: Job 20:27
verses.text: The heaven shall reveal his iniquity; and the earth shall rise up against him.

verses.name: Job 20:28
verses.text: The increase of his house shall depart, and his goods shall flow away in the day of his wrath.

verses.name: Job 20:29
verses.text: This is the portion of a wicked man from God, and the heritage appointed unto him by God.
